intro: Rochefortia acanthophora, commonly known as the prickly rochefortia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its robust, fleshy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often covered in spines, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pale yellow to white and attract pollinators such as bees and moths.
